options.text: Population of India has crossed 1 million in May 2000.
Cervical caps and vaults both are barrier methods of contraception.
Government of India has legalized MTP act in 1981

solution.text:
Barrier methods of contraception:
These methods prevent the ovum and sperms from physically meeting. Such methods are available for both males and females.

Examples :
A. Condoms: These are made up of thin rubber/latex sheath that covers the penis in the male or vagina and cervix in the female, just before coitus so that the semen may not be ejaculated into the female reproductive tract.

'Nirodh': Popular brand of condom for the male.

B. Diaphragms, cervical caps and vaults: These are made of rubber that is inserted into the female reproductive tract to cover the cervix during coitus. Spermicidal creams, jellies and foams can also be used with barrier methods to increase their efficiency.
